nl.strohalm.cyclos.services.elements

Interface ElementService

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Service
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ElementServiceLocal
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ElementServiceImpl, ElementServiceSecurity

    public interface ElementService
extends Service
    Service interface for elements. Elements are used to control global member related operations. Members and Administrators descend from the same Element entity.
    Author:
    rafael

    • Method Detail

      • acceptAgreement

        void acceptAgreement(java.lang.String remoteAddress)
        Used for a member to accept to accept the current registration agreement of his group

      • bulkChangeMemberChannels

        BulkMemberActionResultVO bulkChangeMemberChannels(FullTextMemberQuery query,
                                                java.util.Collection<Channel> enableChannels,
                                                java.util.Collection<Channel> disableChannels)
                                                  throws ValidationException
        Changes the accessible channels of all members returned by the query. For members that can not access an enabled nothing is done.
        Throws:
        ValidationException

      • bulkChangeMemberGroup

        BulkMemberActionResultVO bulkChangeMemberGroup(FullTextMemberQuery query,
                                             MemberGroup newGroup,
                                             java.lang.String comments)
                                               throws ValidationException
        Changes the group of all members returned by the query. For members that are already on the selected group, nothing is done.
        Throws:
        ValidationException

      • changeGroup

        <E extends Element> E changeGroup(E element,
                                Group newGroup,
                                java.lang.String comments)
                              throws MemberHasBalanceException,
                                     MemberHasOpenInvoicesException,
                                     ValidationException
        Changes the group of the specified user. If the new group has status of removed:
        • Only let the group be changed if there are no accounts with balance and no open invoices
        • All contacts must be removed
        • If the member is a broker, all brokered members should have their broker changed to null, generating a remark with messageSettings.brokerRemovedMessage as comments
        Throws:
        MemberHasBalanceException - When the new group is removed and the member has balance on any of his accounts
        MemberHasOpenInvoicesException - When the new group is removed and the member has open incoming invoices
        ValidationException - When any of the arguments are null or empty, when the new group is the same as the old or when the member is removed

      • changeProfile

        <E extends Element> E changeProfile(E element)
        Used to save the profile of an element

      • confirmEmailChange

        PendingEmailChange confirmEmailChange(java.lang.String key)
                                      throws EntityNotFoundException
        Confirms a pending e-mail change for the logged user under the given key. If none, throws EntityNotFoundException
        Throws:
        EntityNotFoundException

      • fullTextSearch

        java.util.List<? extends Element> fullTextSearch(FullTextElementQuery query)
        Search the existing elements using a full text search, based on the given query parameters
        Returns:
        a list of elements

        ElementVO getElementVO(long id)
        Returns a VO with the element information for the given element id.

        java.util.Calendar getFirstMemberActivationDate()
        Returns the date of the first member activation of the system

      • getPendingEmailChange

        PendingEmailChange getPendingEmailChange(Member member)
        Returns the current PendingEmailChange, if any

      • getPossibleNewGroups

        java.util.List<? extends Group> getPossibleNewGroups(Element element)
        Lists the possible new groups for the given element, ordering by nature (admin / member then broker / operator) and name. If the group is removed, it can't be changed, so, the list will contain only it. Otherwise, returns all other groups, according to the group nature.

      • invitePerson

        void invitePerson(java.lang.String email)
        Sends an invitational e-mail to some person.

        EntityNotFoundException - When the given id does not exist

      • loadUser

        <T extends User> T loadUser(java.lang.String username,
                          Relationship... fetch)
                        throws EntityNotFoundException
        Loads the user by username, fetching the specified relationships May only return users of type AdminUser or MemberUser. Operators have the #loadOperatorUser(Member, String, Relationship[])
        Throws:
        EntityNotFoundException - When the given username does not exist

      • publicValidateRegistration

        Member publicValidateRegistration(java.lang.String key)
                                  throws EntityNotFoundException,
                                         RegistrationAgreementNotAcceptedException
        Confirms the validation key
        Throws:
        EntityNotFoundException - When there is no pending validation for the given key
        RegistrationAgreementNotAcceptedException - When the user should accept an agreement before validating the registration

      • register

        java.lang.Object register(Element element,
                        boolean forceChangePassword,
                        java.lang.String remoteAddress)
        Registers a new user. The result type is Object because when registering a member, if the e-mail validation is enabled, the result is a PendingMember instead.
        Throws:
        NoInitialGroupException - When there aren't possible groups to be used as initial

      • reloadUser

        <T extends User> T reloadUser(java.lang.Long id,
                            Relationship... fetch)
                          throws EntityNotFoundException
        Reloads the user from the Database
        Throws:
        EntityNotFoundException

      • remove

        void remove(java.lang.Long id)
            throws UnexpectedEntityException
        Removes the specified user. Unless the user had no activity on the system, this operation won't be permitted. In that case, the user should be moved into a removed group.
        Throws:
        UnexpectedEntityException - When the given id is for a member, and he/she is currently active (has open loans / invoices or non-zero accounts, for example)

      • removePendingMembers

        int removePendingMembers(java.lang.Long... ids)
        Removes the given pending members

        Throws:
        MailSendingException
